TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and residing in GPE . He is a lawyer by profession .
A.
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) dissolved the applicant ’s marriage with PERSON ORG based its decision on an agreement the applicant and his wife had concluded DATE in court which , inter alia , provided that custody of the CARDINAL children , PERSON and PERSON , be granted to her .
On DATE the applicant remarried .
On DATE the applicant introduced a request with ORG for reduction of the maintenance payments for PERSON and PERSON These proceedings are the subject of application No . DATE .
On DATE the applicant introduced court proceedings with ORG against his divorced wife for transfer to him of the custody of PERSON and PERSON
On DATE the ORG heard GPE
On DATE PERSON requested ORG to hear CARDINAL witnesses . On CARDINAL and DATE the applicant requested ORG to hear altogether CARDINAL witnesses and to obtain the opinion of a medical expert .
On DATE ORG appointed an expert child psychologist .
On DATE Judge PERSON who had been dealing with the applicant ’s case was replaced by Judge PERSON
On DATE the applicant requested ORG to transfer custody provisionally to him and to hear further CARDINAL witnesses .

On DATE the expert submitted his report to ORG . On DATE the expert ’s report was transmitted to the parties . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to order the expert to amend his report . He also requested that a hearing be held in order to discuss the report . On DATE and DATE PERSON commented on the expert ’s report . On DATE the applicant made further submissions . He also requested that he and CARDINAL more witness be heard .
On DATE the Braunau ORG heard CARDINAL witness on letters rogatory .

On DATE a hearing took place before GPE . The case had meanwhile been assigned to Judge PERSON In the course of the hearing ORG heard CARDINAL witnesses . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to hear a further CARDINAL witnesses . He also withdrew a previous request for the hearing of CARDINAL witness .

On DATE hearings took place before ORG in which the court heard the applicant and CARDINAL witnesses . On DATE and DATE the applicant requested ORG to hear a further CARDINAL witnesses and to instruct the expert to amend his report of DATE .
On DATE and DATE the parties made further submissions to ORG .

On DATE ORG summoned the parties to a hearing scheduled for DATE . This hearing was postponed to CARDINAL DATE , on the request of C.T , when ORG heard CARDINAL witnesses and distributed an amended expert report .
On DATE and DATE ORG heard CARDINAL witnesses in the absence of the parties . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to hear a further CARDINAL witnesses .

On DATE the applicant filed a request with ORG ( PERSON ) to set ORG a time limit for holding a hearing . He submitted that since DATE no hearing had taken place , and that the transcript of this court hearing had not yet been transmitted to the parties .

On DATE a hearing took place before ORG , which heard PERSON and decided that the appointed expert should , after an examination of the parties and the children , prepare a new report . This report was submitted on CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , and DATE the ORG heard CARDINAL witnesses in the absence of the parties . On DATE the applicant made further submissions to ORG . On DATE ORG heard CARDINAL witness , already heard on DATE , in the absence of the parties .
On DATE the applicant requested ORG to grant the transmission to the parties of the material upon which the expert had based his report of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the ORG heard CARDINAL witnesses , already heard on CARDINAL , DATE and DATE , in the absence of the parties .
On DATE a hearing took place before ORG in which the expert ’s report of CARDINAL DATE was discussed . The applicant requested amendments to the report and the hearing of further witnesses .
On DATE the Judge PERSON left GPE . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to resume the taking of evidence because of the change in judge .
On DATE the President of ORG assigned the applicant ’s case to Judge PERSON ( who had previously dealt with the case in DATE ) .

On DATE the ORG heard PERSON , PERSON and PERSON and PERSON ’s companion in the absence of the applicant . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to hear CARDINAL further witnesses . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the ORG heard the applicant and his second wife in the absence of PERSON On DATE the ORG heard PERSON in the absence of the applicant . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to re - hear in his presence all previous witnesses .
On DATE Judge PERSON declared that she felt bias against the applicant .

On DATE the applicant filed an application for a time - limit to be set for a decision on this declaration . On DATE the President himself requested that he be withdrawn from the case for bias . Both requests were dismissed . Judge PERSON ’s appeal of CARDINAL DATE was rejected on DATE .

Meanwhile , on DATE the applicant had filed a motion challenging the probable substitute Judge PERSON for bias . And on DATE , the applicant had filed a motion challenging Judge PERSON for bias . On DATE he filed an application for a time - limit to be set for the delivery of a decision on his latter request .
His applications were dismissed on DATE and CARDINAL DATE , respectively . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) , following the applicant ’s appeal , withdrew Judge PERSON from the case .
On DATE Judge PERSON was appointed to deal with the case but was also challenged for bias by the applicant on DATE . On DATE Judge PERSON was appointed to deal with the case .

On DATE the court heard PERSON and PERSON ’s companion . On DATE the applicant made further submissions . On DATE the court heard the applicant and his second wife . On DATE an expert was appointed . On DATE the court heard PERSON and her father . On DATE another expert was appointed .
On DATE the applicant ’s children were granted legal aid . The applicant appealed against this decision on DATE .
On DATE the expert submitted his report to the court . On DATE the applicant requested the court to hold a hearing in which the expert opinion be discussed in the presence of the expert .

On DATE the hearing was scheduled for DATE . Following the applicant ’s request for an adjournment , the hearing was postponed until DATE . Granting the defendants’ motion for an adjournment , the court further postponed the hearing until DATE . Following another request for an adjournment by the applicant , the hearing was eventually held on DATE .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for the transfer of custody and withdrew his right of access . Having regard to the submissions of the parties , the evidence of CARDINAL witnesses , several expert opinions , documentary evidence and the case files of CARDINAL related cases , ORG found that the children were well cared for by their mother and that continuity in exercising custody was important for the children ’s well - being . Furthermore , the children ’s feelings towards their father were negative or at best ambivalent . Therefore the court found no reason to transfer their custody from their mother to the applicant . As to the withdrawal of the right of access , the court noted that the right of access like the right of custody
On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal , which was dismissed on DATE by ORG for essentially the same reasons as those given by ORG .
On DATE the applicant lodged a further appeal , which was dismissed on DATE by ORG , whose decision was served on DATE .
